Description: Wall sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed with incised lotus flower painted red and white; exterior fired red-brown, cream slip; two friezes with filling ornaments divided by white-red-white band; floral in upper frieze, only filling ornament preserved in lower.
Curator's comments: Part of 1888,0601.534a-f, fired more red, as on 534d.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.235)
